member.name: T:Shamisen.Units
member.summary: The concepts for Units.

member.name: P:Shamisen.Units.Frame
member.summary:
The is a packed unit of multiple audio s.
A single contains the same number of samples as the channel of the stream.
For example, the length of frames in the 2ch audio data in bytes is sizeof(float) * 4, which is 16.

member.name: P:Shamisen.Units.Sample
member.summary:
The is a smallest unit of the multi-channel discrete(digital) audio data.
The besides channel-by-channel, so the length of frame in bytes is the size of the sample itself, multiplied by the number of channels.

member.name: T:Shamisen.Conversion.Resampling.Sample.SplineResampler
member.summary: Performs up-sampling using Catmull-Rom Spline interpolation.

member.name: F:Shamisen.Conversion.Resampling.Sample.SplineResampler.preCalculatedCatmullRomCoefficients
member.summary:
The pre calculated Catmull-Rom coefficients.
X: The coefficient for value1 ((-xP3 + 2 * xP2 - x) * 0.5f)
Y: The coefficient for value2 (((3 * xP3) - (5 * xP2) + 2) * 0.5f)
Z: The coefficient for value3 ((-(3 * xP3) + 4 * xP2 + x) * 0.5f)
W: The coefficient for value4 ((xP3 - xP2) * 0.5f)

member.name: M:Shamisen.Conversion.SampleToWaveConverters.SampleToPcm32Converter.Convert(System.Single)
member.summary:
Clamps the specified between -1 and 1, and then converts to .
Note that the value >= 1.0f will be converted to instead of 0 or 2147483520 in order to avoid overflows and quantization noises.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Conversion.SampleToWaveConverters.SampleToPcm32Converter.ConvertScaled(System.Single)
member.summary:
Clamps the specified between -2147483648.0f and 2147483648.0f, and then converts to .
Note that the value >= 1.0f will be converted to instead of 0 or 2147483520 in order to avoid overflows and quantization noises.

member.summary: Filters audio signal with multiple Digital BiQuad Filter.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Filters.BiQuad.Cascaded.CascadedBiQuadFilter.#ctor(Shamisen.IReadableAudioSource{System.Single,Shamisen.SampleFormat},Shamisen.Filters.BiQuadParameter[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: M:Shamisen.Filters.BiQuad.Cascaded.CascadedBiQuadFilter.#ctor(Shamisen.IReadableAudioSource{System.Single,Shamisen.SampleFormat},Shamisen.Filters.BiQuad.Cascaded.CascadedBiQuadParameters)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: M:Shamisen.Filters.BiQuad.Cascaded.CascadedBiQuadFilter.Process.X86.ProcessMonauralOrder8Avx2(System.Span{System.Single},System.Span{System.Single},System.Span{System.Single})
member.summary:
Processes the signal with 5-8 order of cascaded BiQuad filters with the technique called "software pipelining".
Software pipelining enables us to implement cascaded BiQuad parallelization as we did in scalar version of single BiQuad filter.
The bypass can be represented by 1.0f for b0 and 0.0f for b1, b2, a1, and a2.
The orders more than 8 should be processed with serially cascaded function calls.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Filters.BiQuad.Cascaded.CascadedBiQuadFilter.Process.X86.ProcessMonauralOrder4Sse41(System.Span{System.Single},System.Span{System.Single},System.Span{System.Single})
member.summary:
Processes the signal with 2-4 order of cascaded BiQuad filters with the technique called "software pipelining".
Single BiQuad filters must be processed with .
Software pipelining enables us to implement cascaded BiQuad parallelization as we did in scalar version of single BiQuad filter.
The bypass can be represented by 1.0f for b0 and 0.0f for b1, b2, a1, and a2.

member.name: T:Shamisen.Filters.Multiplier
member.summary:
Multiplies the instantaneous values of the two sources.
It can be used to gradually modify the volume of a .
If you put two with different frequencies, the output will be a mix of two new sinusoid with two different frequencies, one at sum, and the other at difference.

For reference of "Qm.n" notation: See here and here.

member.name: M:Shamisen.OffsetSByte.TryParse(System.String,Shamisen.OffsetSByte@)
member.summary:
Converts the string representation of a number to its equivalent.
A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null or , is not a number in a valid format, or represents a number less than or greater than . This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result is overwritten.
member.returns: true if was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.AudioUtils.FastScalarMultiplyStandardFixed(System.Span{System.Single},System.Single)
member.summary:
Vectorized path using which uses 128bits vectors like xmmN(x86) or vN.4f(ARMv8).
Impractical in Rocket Lake or later due to absence of Haswell's severe CPU clock limits.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.AudioUtils.FastScalarMultiplyStandardVariable(System.Span{System.Single},System.Single)
member.summary:
Vectorized path using which uses variable-sized vectors.
Performs better in either ARMv8, Rocket Lake or later, or pre-Sandy-Bridge x64 CPUs due to CPU clock limits.
Future versions of .NET may improve performance if utilizes either x64 AVX-512 or ARMv8.2-A SVE.

member.returns: The integer nearest . If the fractional component of is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned. Note that this method returns a instead of an integral type.

member.summary: Contains some utility functions for manipulating values.

member.summary: Returns the dot product of two vectors.
member.returns: The dot product of two vectors.

member.summary: Returns the dot product of two vectors.
member.returns: The dot product of two vectors.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.ReverseElements(System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Returns a new value with reversed elements of .

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.FastDotMultiple2Channels(System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Returns the dot product of 4 frames x 2 channels tensor at and specified .
member.param: The location of frames to read.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.FastDotMultiple3Channels(System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Returns the dot product of 4 frames x 3 channels at and specified .
member.param: The location of frames to read.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.Blend(System.Numerics.Vector{System.Int32},System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single},System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single})
member.summary: Creates a new single-precision vector with elements selected between two specified single-precision source vectors based on an integral mask vector.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.Blend(System.Numerics.Vector{System.Int32},System.Numerics.Vector{System.Int32},System.Numerics.Vector{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a new 32-bit integer vector with elements selected between two specified 32-bit integer source vectors based on an integral mask vector.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.Round(System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single})
member.summary: Rounds a vector of single-precision floating-point value to the nearest integral values, and rounds midpoint values to the nearest even number.
member.param: A vector of single-precision floating-point numbers to be rounded.
member.returns: The integer nearest . If the fractional component of is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned. Note that this method returns a floating-point instead of an integral .

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.RoundInLoop(System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single},System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single},System.Numerics.Vector{System.Single})
member.summary:
Rounds a vector of single-precision floating-point value to the nearest integral values, and rounds midpoint values to the nearest even number.
This one is suitable for processing inside loops.
member.param: A vector of single-precision floating-point numbers to be rounded.
A broadcast vector with only sign bits set. If you pass wrong value, this function won't work as intended.
A broadcast vector represents 16777216f. If you pass wrong value, this function won't work as intended.
member.returns: The integer nearest . If the fractional component of is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned. Note that this method returns a floating-point instead of an integral .

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.VectorUtils.AddAsInt32(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Adds two values as if values are .
member.returns: The added value.

member.name: M:Shamisen.BinaryExtensions.TryReadDoubleLittleEndian(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Double@)
member.summary:
Reads a from the beginning of a read-only span of bytes, as little endian.
This method poly-fills the method for non-supported frameworks.
member.param: The read-only span of bytes to read.
When this method returns, contains the value read out of the read-only span of bytes, as little endian.
member.returns: true if the span is large enough to contain a ; otherwise, false.

When this method returns, contains the value read out of the read-only span of bytes, as Big endian.
member.returns: true if the span is large enough to contain a ; otherwise, false.
